Class Leaderboard

java.lang.Object
Leaderboard
public class Leaderboard extends Object
Version:
2.0 Represents a leaderboard for tracking and displaying player rankings based on their scores. This class uses a LinkedList to store player information, allowing efficient insertion and removal operations.
Author:
Simran Kullar

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Leaderboard(LinkedList<Player> players)
    Constructs a Leaderboard instance with a predefined list of players.

  • Constructor Details

    • Leaderboard

      public Leaderboard(LinkedList<Player> players)
      Constructs a Leaderboard instance with a predefined list of players.
      Parameters:
      players - The initial LinkedList of players to be included in the leaderboard.

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a new player to the leaderboard. If the player is already in the leaderboard or is null, the method will not add the player and may print a message indicating the issue.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be added to the leaderboard.

    • changeRank

      public void changeRank(Player player, int newRank)
      Changes the rank of a given player to a new position. If the new rank is out of current list bounds, the player is moved to the end of the list. If the player is not found, a message may be printed.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose rank is to be changed.
      newRank - The new rank position for the player, where the first rank is 1.

    • displayLeaderboard

      public void displayLeaderboard()
      Displays the current leaderboard with players' ranks, IDs, and scores. Iterates through the LinkedList of players and prints their details to the console

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(LinkedList<Player> players)
      Updates the entire list of players in the leaderboard by replacing it with a new LinkedList of players
      Parameters:
      players - The new LinkedList of players to replace the current one

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(String playerId)
      Retrieves a player from the leaderboard based on their ID
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player to retrieve
      Returns:
      The Player object if found, or null if no player with the given ID exists on the leaderboard

    • getTopPlayer

      public Player getTopPlayer()
